claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling in tumor tissue

evidence.quote: Type I interferon response score (normalized units) | 3.1 | 1.0 | Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.

claims.caveat: While the interferon response was robustly induced, the study noted that some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase following intratumoral mRNA vaccination

evidence.quote: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome | 62.3% | 37.3% | Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination
Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6% | Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape

claims.caveat: The expansion of the antigen presentation landscape was demonstrated in preclinical models, but translation to human tumors requires further validation.

claims.claim: A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells following vaccination

evidence.quote: Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6% | Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape
Intratumoral CD8+ T-cell density fold-change | 1.8x | 1.0x | Increased immune infiltration with combination therapy

claims.caveat: Increased CD8+ T-cell infiltration was observed with combination therapy, but the direct causal link between expanded MHC-I peptidome and T-cell response requires additional mechanistic studies.

claims.claim: PD-L1 pathway activity increases after mRNA vaccination, creating rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade

evidence.quote: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue | 2.4x | 1.0x | Checkpoint axis became more targetable

claims.caveat: The upregulation of PD-L1 provides mechanistic justification for the combination approach, though optimal timing of vaccination relative to ICI initiation requires clarification.

claims.claim: Combined intratumoral mRNA vaccination and anti-PD-L1 therapy improves tumor control in preclinical models

evidence.quote: Vehicle-only treatment did not produce durable tumor control in non-immunogenic models. ICI-only treatment had limited activity in low-immunogenic baseline settings.
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: While combination therapy showed efficacy in mouse models, mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors, limiting direct translational interpretation.

claims.claim: Patients with prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination showed improved survival outcomes under ICI treatment in retrospective analysis

evidence.quote: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | N/A | Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely, and vaccination timing relative to ICI initiation varied across patients.
